page.title: 10 A SPECIAL SCHOOL
page.content: Ramsden Hall is a residential special school for boys of 10-17. It was not always a school as it used to belong to squire Bakem. The hall was built in 1852, but then another wing was built on to it in 1900. It is a delightful property surrounded by open fields and woodland. There are{fifty three}boys there at the moment but soon there will be more.There are{seven}teachers who each work for four or five hours a day. There is no homework for the boys unless vitally necessary. The school owns fourteen acres of land,upon which there is a small farm. They keep goats,chickens, sheep,ducks and rabbits. There is also a horse which they use for riding.They are lucky enough to have an open air swimming pool which they use during the summer.
